title: Joe Giudice says immigration officers 'were taking selfies with me' post release
text:
He has been released from ICE custody and permitted to return an Italy before a final legal decision on his deportation there.

And Joe Giudice, husband of Real Housewife Of New Jersey Teresa Giudice, spilled some of the details of his transfer to Italy on Watch What Happens Live.

In a preview clip for an upcoming episode, the 47-year-old beefcake told host Andy Cohen that immigration officers 'were taking selfies with me the whole time.'

Letting it out: Joe Giudice, husband of Real Housewife Of New Jersey Teresa Giudice, spilled some of the details of his transfer to Italy on Watch What Happens Live

He told Andy, the producer behind the Real Housewives, that 'they wanted to handcuff me. I was like listen: "I am not getting in no handcuffs."'

To a skeptical expression from Andy, Joe claimed: 'They’re like: “Are you gonna behave?" I’m like: "What the hell am I gonna do? If I wanted to leave, I would like, just kick your butts and leave." I’m like: "I ain’t gonna do that."'

Joe, who had himself requested to be preemptively allowed to move to Italy, said: 'I go: "I wanna go on a plane. I wanna get the hell outta here."'

He dished that at the airport in Washington, D.C. 'We had to meet all these other security guards. I don’t know who was DAA or DA or whatever the hell you wanna call ‘em, and immigra- I had two immigration officers, one on each side. They’re taking selfies with me the whole time. One guy in front.'

Letting it out: In a preview clip for an upcoming episode, the 47-year-old beefcake told host Andy Cohen that immigration officers 'were taking selfies with me the whole time.'

Joe said: 'And I think there was someone else, you know, that carried a gun or something on the plane, don’t know. You know, I’m a very dangerous guy, I guess.'

The reality TV dreamboat shared: 'They stood on the plane all the way till we got to Rome. I told them where to go have a good time, ‘cause they were staying here till Monday. So they were heading out to a few islands and Naples, and you know, then they were heading back home.'

While Joe gave his interview over video chat from Italy, Teresa was sitting in the studio with Andy to be interviewed on the program.

Tough guy: To a skeptical expression from Andy, Joe claimed to have told officers who wanted to cuff him: 'If I wanted to leave, I would like, just kick your butts and leave'

The Giudices' lawyer James T. Leonard argued in September that Joe should be released to Italy so he could earn a living for his family again, People reported.

Joe was born in Saronno, Lombardy and has been in America since childhood but neglected to ever obtain U.S. citizenship, leaving him vulnerable to deportation after he and Teresa were convicted of various counts of fraud in 2014.

Both Joe and Teresa spent time in jail, serving back-to-back sentences so that one parent at a time could be home with the children.

'You know, I'm a very dangerous guy, I guess': Joe said: 'And I think there was someone else, you know, that carried a gun or something on the plane, don’t know'

The reality TV star couple have been married since 1999 and have four daughters - Gia, 18, Gabriella, 15, Milania, 14, and Audriana, 10.

After his 36-month prison stint, Joe was transferred straight to the Clinton County Correctional Center in Pennsylvania and into the hands of ICE this March.

Joe's deportation was court ordered last October and his multiple appeal requests have so far fallen on deaf ears.
description: He has been released from ICE custody and permitted to return an Italy before a final legal decision on his deportation there.
